bibl.title: M. L. Coovert for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1890-1901, vol 1

div1.p: I, C. D. Bowles, first being duly sworn according to law, depose and say as follows: I accuse M. L. Coovert, of Vancouver, Clarke County, State of Washington, of the crime of selling and furnishing cigarettes, contrary to the statute in such cases made and provided, committed as follows: Said M. L. Coovert is a retail tobacco dealer doing business in Vancouver, County of Clarke, State of Washington, and on Friday, June the 9th, 1893, at his said place of business in said city of Vancouver, the said M. L. Coovert did sell and furnish to one C. L. McDonald on package of cigarettes, more particularly described as follows:

a pasteboard box with loose fitting top and without mark of any description upon part of said box, paid box containing five packages of vanity Fair paper wrapped cigarettes, each of said packages having upon it the name of the brand of cigarettes, the statutory caution notice US Revenuestamp duly canceled and number of the manufacturing district and plate, and each of said packages containing ten cigarettes.
which said packages of cigarettes and is of the value of twenty five cents
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 9th day of June, 1893. C. D. Bowles H. R. Caples County Clerk.
